channel.description: Recent content in Posts on Charlie's Blog

item.title: CircuitryBasicsNotes
item.description:
Notes About Circuitry

Pre-read

Before I begin the notes, the main things I have questions on are:

Do batteries have resistance; why can my microcontroller supply a 5/3v voltage, but not very high amps?

How do resistors stop current flow; do they also reduce voltage?

How do I understand intutively and deeply how electricity flows?

How do I understand the current and voltage at every part of a circuit?

Intuitively, what does current vs. voltage do?

item.title: Autosocial
item.description:
Content below was automatically extracted from the readme.md of my autosocial LLM integration project:

autosocial

Automatically posts to all desired socials, finetuned LLM writes appealing/good titles and descriptions for each platform.

item.title: Jupyter-To-Site
item.description:
Here, we’ll be parsing our jupyter notebook from a random github link, and reading it out into markdown:

  1. Markdown = markdown
  2. Code = markdown code block
  3. Code output = Images/code block

Furthermore, we will fetch a github repo and automatically update it, when the file at the given like has been updated.

Latstly, we’ll be able to stack multiple notebooks into one ‘project’.

Running scripts on website

Since our site is static, we’ll need to have a built-in link to displaying our github page, and automatically converting it to markdown somehow inbetween.
